action.action-desc: Mr. Yarmuth (for himself and Mr. Womack) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To clarify the treatment of drawback on distilled spirits, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Duty Drawback Clarification Act.

section.header: Clarification of treatment of drawback on distilled spirits

subsection.text: Section 5008(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The proprietor and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:
The destruction of distilled spirits under paragraph (1) may not be used as the basis for a claim for drawback under section 313 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1313).

subsection.text: Section 313(j) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1313(j)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In the case of whiskey classifiable under subheading 2208.30 of the HTS, this subsection shall be applied and administered—

subparagraph.text: by substituting 6-digit HTS subheading number for 8-digit HTS subheading number each place it appears; and
in paragraph (6)(A), by substituting 6 digits for 8 digits.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect and apply to drawback claims filed upon or after the date of enactment of this Act.
